pr_title: Do not change default version unless asked

timeline.message: changes to not change the default version of a model unless asked

timeline.bodyText:
This change looks okay, but there's a problem in line 50:
if (this.modelsVersionMap.putIfAbsent(Double.valueOf(versionId), model) != null) {

This cast to double is problematic. The version is taken in by the model archiver as a string (qv: model-archiver/model_archiver/arg_parser.py). If someone includes a version string that can't be cast to a double ("1.0.1", "v1.0"), they'll get no error from the model archiver, but this method will throw a java.lang.NumberFormatException.
Is there any reason modelsVersionMap can't be a ConcurrentHashMap<String, Model>?
timeline.author: fbbradheintz

replies.bodyText: This is also a problem in lines 25 & 26 of this file, and in line 141 of http/ManagementRequestHandler.java.
replies.author: fbbradheintz

timeline.bodyText: This PR is looking much better. The only thing missing is a test case for non-Double-parseable version strings, e.g. "v1.0.3".
timeline.author: fbbradheintz

replies.bodyText: Done, updated 1.2 to 1.2.1 in the existing UT mar file.
replies.author: harshbafna

timeline.message: changed model version to string format in UT
updated missed out version change in UT

made changes for fixing build failures merging stage_release branch
